column4: question - why would i resolve hostname-2.local but not hostname.local? this is dual boot machine and the XP instance has the same computer name (so i can resolve locally to either when it is booted)
no -2 just says 127.x.x.x localhost and hostname
cat /etc/hosts and put it in pastebin
/etc/hostname is not being looked at when doing name resolution :)
/etc/hosts looks normal i don't see any -2 or any reason it wouldn't resolve locally (even other computers on the network resolve to hostname-2.local but nobody answers to hostname.local
1. cat /etc/hosts and put it in pastebin 2. what exactly are you trying to do?
I am trying to have other computers resolve on the local network to this machine using hostname.local
do you have a DNS server set up?
pasted in pastebin ... computer is named homebrew and when i do a ping homebrew.local it does not answer (however a ping homebrew-2.local) does
a link to pastebin with text would be most helpful :)
what's the link to your pastebinned output?
- i restarted avahi-daemon and it is now working ... i don't know why this is.  I didn't change any of the conf files
my thoughts are that there was a remnant of the hostname.local from the XP instance and avahi didn't want to stomp on it so it just added the -2
could be ... but I suggest having a real DNS server :P
a few more reboots will tell the tale (maybe I'll do a script that sleeps for a bit and then restarts avahi on reboot
